00034 // =============================================================================
00036 void Click :: init()
00037 {   
00038 
00039     pValid_.push_back(aw::pNameRate);
00040     pTypeMap_[aw::pNameRate] = aw::gTypeMono;
00041 
00042     pValid_.push_back(aw::pNameAmplitude);
00043     pTypeMap_[aw::pNameAmplitude] = aw::gTypeMono;
00044 
00045     // setup some default generators 
00046     Generator::setParameter(aw::pNameRate, 1,
00047                     aw::pContextNamePeriodSeconds);
00048     Generator::setParameter(aw::pNameAmplitude, 1,
00049                     aw::pContextNameNone);
00050 
00051     reset();
00052 }

00070 // =============================================================================
00071 // set frequency
00072 
00073 // if our frequency is .5 hz, it means that our period is 2 seconds
00074 // if our frequency is 2 hz, it means tt our period is .5 second
00075 // if fq is 4 hz, period is .25 seconds
00076 // p == 1 / fq
00077 // fq == 1/ p
00078 
00079 
00080 
00081 
00082 // =============================================================================
00083 double Click :: getValueAtSample(aw::SampleTimeType st)
00084 {
00085     
00086     sampleTime_ = st;
00087     sr_ = sys_->getSamplingRate();
00088 
00089     periodSamples_ = pMap_[aw::pNameRate]->getValueAtSample(sampleTime_);
00090     periodSamples_ = getValueWithContextToPeriodSamples(periodSamples_,
00091                      aw::pNameRate, sr_);
00092 
00093     // take mod of period
00094     sampleTime_ = fmod(sampleTime_, periodSamples_);
00095     
00096     // only update amplitude, and provide output, at sample time zero, 
00097     // or the beginning of each period
00098     if (sampleTime_ < 1.0) {
00099         // need to pass original sample time here!
00100         value_ = pMap_[aw::pNameAmplitude]->getValueAtSample(st);
00101     }
00102     else
00103         value_ = 0;
00104 
00105     // normalize and scale
00106     return value_;
00107 };
